result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason G Gehl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Concurrent with: each count.

miscConds.notes: Costs/Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.
Defendant is not to possess any bladed weapons or firearms.  If these is a knife involved, it is to be FORFEITED.

No violent contact with victims J.W., B.W., J.S., and M.M.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Sign release for Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Defendant Jason G Gehl in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1 and 2 with the weapon enhancer struck on count #2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of counts 1 and 2.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Weitzner makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  State has com

The Court Orders the Following: Count 1   
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
90 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 0 days).  Concurrent to each count.  
Term of Probation: 18 months
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;	
No violent contact with victims J.W., B.W., J.S., M.M.
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
Sign Release for Agent;
Defendant is not to possess any bladed weapons orfirearms.
If there is a knife involved, it is to be forfeited. 
Condition Time: 10 days Huber with  NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion
FINE or COSTS:  $243.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge: $200.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel, Atty Cameron Weitzner
dated Dec 18, 2015 from Atty Cameron Weitzner,   Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel

Defendant Jason G Gehl in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint except for incidental contact with Marilyn M..  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.  Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

Defendant Jason G Gehl in court.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
